thread.title: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders supporters host Syracuse debate watch parties tonight
thread.title_full: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders supporters host Syracuse debate watch parties tonight

author: Mark Weiner | mweiner@syracuse.com
title: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders supporters host Syracuse debate watch parties tonight
text:
Comments 
The campaigns of Democratic presidential candidates Hillary Clinton and Bernie Sanders will host parties Tuesday night in Syracuse for supporters to watch the live televised debate from Las Vegas. 
Syracuse Mayor Stephanie Miner is the Hillary Clinton campaign's designated host for the watch party starting at 8:30 p.m. at the Change of Pace, 1802 Grant Blvd. The event is open to public but attendees are asked to RSVP with Hillary for America . 
Miner was among the first elected officials in the Syracuse area to endorse Clinton, the former New York senator, for president. The Syracuse watch party is among more than 100 planned across New York, according to the Clinton campaign. 
Supporters of Sanders, the U.S. senator from Vermont, plan at least three watch parties in private homes in Central New York and one public watch party in Solvay. 
The Sanders watch party open to the public will be 8 to 10 p.m. at the Bridge Street Tavern, 109 Bridge Street, Solvay. 
Host Lauren Livingston wrote on the Sanders invite page that "all parties, supporters and skeptics" are welcome to attend the event. 
Former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley, former Virginia Sen. Jim Webb, and former Rhode Island Gov. Lincoln Chafee also will take part in the first Democratic debate, which begins at 9 p.m. in Las Vegas and will be broadcast by CNN. Coverage starts at 8:30 p.m.
